com.cjsavage.java.net.discovery

Class ServiceAnnouncer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cjsavage.java.net.discovery.ServiceAnnouncer

  • public class ServiceAnnouncer
extends Object
    Used to announce the presence of a server that provides specific services.

    See the package summary for example usage.

    A single ServiceAnnouncer can announce for several services and servers simultaneously. Services/servers can be registered with addService(ServiceInfo).

    ServiceFinder instances are used to send requests. The request contains the response method (multicast or TCP). Multicast responses are always sent on the same group/port that is listened on. TCP responses are sent to the sending IP address and the request contains the port to respond on.

    Since:
    1.0

      • hasServiceId

        Returns true if this announcer contains a ServiceInfo instance for the service ID.

        Returns:

        Wrapper around stopListening() and startListening().

      • removeService

        public void removeService(ServiceInfo service)
        Removes a previously added service. This method passes the service's ID to removeService(String id).
        Parameters:
        service - the ServiceInfo containing the service ID to remove

      • removeService

        public void removeService(String id)
        Removes a previously added service ID.
        Parameters:
        id - the service ID to remove

      • getMulticastGroup

        public InetAddress getMulticastGroup()
        Returns the group the internal MulticastSocket will join. This is the group that was passed to the constructor or set via setMulticastGroup(java.net.InetAddress).
        Returns:
        the InetAddress passed to the constructor or setMulticastGroup

      • setMulticastGroup

        public void setMulticastGroup(InetAddress group)
        Sets the group the internal MulticastSocket will join. If this is called on an actively listening ServerAnnouncer, stopListening() and startListening() will be called.
        Parameters:
        group - the group to join
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if group is null

      • getMulticastPort

        public int getMulticastPort()
        Returns the port that this ServerAnnouncer will listen on.
        Returns:
        the port that this ServerAnnouncer will listen on

      • setMulticastPort

        public void setMulticastPort(int port)
        Sets the port that this ServerAnnouncer will listen on. If this is called on an actively listening ServerAnnouncer, stopListening() and startListening() will be called.
        Parameters:
        port - the port that this ServerAnnouncer will listen on
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if port is not between 1 and 65535
